intro: Palicourea egensis, commonly known as the Caribbean moonseed, is a flowering plant native to the Caribbean region. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family, which includes coffee and gardenias. The plant is characterized by its small, fragrant white flowers and elliptical leaves. It typically grows in humid, shaded environments such as forests and rocky areas. Palicourea egensis is also valued for its medicinal properties, traditionally used in herbal remedies.
